item.title: My Liberal Friend Won’t Protest. Do I Drop Her?
item.description: I feel like apathy is how we got here in the first place.

item.title: The Rules of Investing Are Being Loosened. Could It Lead to the Next 1929?
item.description: A group of financiers is trying to convince the public to invest heavily in private equity and crypto — a risky gambit with some real 1920s vibes.

item.title: How Getting Stoned With My Dad Helped Us Heal
item.description: It was the therapy we needed, and the fun we deserved, after decades of estrangement.

item.title: Inside the Improbable, Audacious and (So Far) Unstoppable Rise of Zohran Mamdani
item.description: The story of the man most likely to be the next mayor of New York City — and the promise and peril his ascent poses for the Democratic Party.

item.title: Five Takeaways From the Magazine’s Profile of Zohran Mamdani
item.description: How the Democratic nominee for mayor who has stunned the New York establishment is working to shore up support and sustain his momentum.

item.title: The Ultimate Pilgrimage for the Middle-Aged Skateboarder
item.description: One of America’s most iconic ’90s skate spots has now been rebuilt in — of all places — Malmo, Sweden.

item.title: What’s Better Than Carrot Cake? This Sweet Potato Version.
item.description: Here, this riff on the classic is more than just a clever trick: It’s a testament to the past.

item.title: I Cut Off a Friend Who Was Abusing Her Daughter. What Can I Do for the Child?
Taylor Swift Is Our Biggest Cinematic Universe. But the Magic Is Fading.
item.description: Pop culture is saturated with franchises, and Swift is the master of creating them. But her marketing is beginning to overtake the music.

item.title: Is It Bad to Buy Into a Gentrified Neighborhood?
item.description: I can finally afford to live in the area I once only dreamed of calling home. But I’m torn.

item.title: Are You Resigned to a World of Bad News? Or Do You Need Some ‘Cope’?
item.description: There are new words for how we process bad news. They’re cynical, hopeful or maybe delusional.

item.title: I Tried to Toughen Up My Son. Things Didn’t Go as Planned.
item.description: A trip to the Badlands with my 8-year old offered lessons in boyhood — and manhood.

item.title: The Case for Strip Malls, the Antidote to Shiny, Soulless City Luxury
item.description: They are hard to love. But they are quirky, outcast spaces that define a community’s unique character.

item.title: ‘You’re Going to Lose Your Mind’: My Three-Day Retreat in Total Darkness
item.description: The author spent days in a room with no light. Who would he be when he emerged?
